name: Single Incision Device (TVT Secur) Versus Retropubic Tension-free Vaginal Tape Device (TVT) for the Management of Stress Urinary Incontinence in Women: A Randomized Clinical Trial
description: The objective of this Canadian multi-centre pragmatic randomized controlled trial was to compare the effectiveness of the new single-incision device, Gynecare TVT Secur, to the established predecate retropubic TVT device, in terms of objective cure of stress urinary incontinence (SUI) at 12 months postoperatively. Other outcomes included: complications, symptoms, and incontinence-related quality of life.

citation.text: Ross S, Tang S, Schulz J, et al. Single incision device (TVT Secur) versus retropubic tension-free vaginal tape device (TVT) for the management of stress urinary incontinence in women: a randomized clinical trial. BMC Research Notes. 2014;7:941.

funder.name: Johnson & Johnson Medical Companies; Alberta Health Services; Women's and Children's Health Research Institute (WCHRI)

spatialCoverage: Calgary, Alberta; Edmonton, Alberta; Vancouver, British Columbia; Penticton, British Columbia
